title.rendered: My Prayer for the New Year

content.rendered:
My prayer for you is that you will find love: that you will find it in yourself, and that it will overflow to those around you. I pray that you find purpose and a sense of belonging.

For my country: I pray that we will set aside our differences and come together, to help one another instead of tearing each other apart. I pray that those who pretend to be will find the courage to truly be what they think they are and hope to be.

For our leaders: Godly wisdom and protection and a return to serving rather than being served.

For the world, that we could set aside our own desires and begin to help those who cannot help themselves, even if it’s just a little: that we would value our lives and the lives of others more than money or religion or politics. I pray that the Prince of Peace would enter the hearts of each and every person.

My prayer for us is that, if we meet, we will be friends: that somehow, with all that is going on in the great big crazy world, we might make a difference.

I pray that whoever I meet will see and feel God’s love and that they will come to know that love for themselves.

My prayer for myself is that I will allow God to work in my life, to do the things that he wants to do. As it says in Jeremiah 29:11 (KJV), ‘“For I know the plans I have for you,” declares the Lord, “plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.” Amen.
